00027 #include "kvi_settings.h"
00028 #include "KviQString.h"
00029 #include "KviKvsTypes.h"
00030 
00031 class MpInterface
00032 {
00033 public:
00034         // don't do any initialization in the constructor
00035         // implement lazy initialization in each function instead
00036         MpInterface(){};
00037         virtual ~MpInterface(){};
00038 protected:
00039         QString m_szLastError;
00040 public:
00041         const QString & lastError() const { return m_szLastError; };
00042 
00043         //
00044         // mandatory interface
00045         //
00046 
00047         // This should attempt to detect if the player is available on the user's system
00048         // and returning a score from 0 to 100 depending on how likely the player will work
00049         // and how many of its functions are available. 100 means that the interface
00050         // is absolutely sure that the player will start and play stuff.
00051         // If bStart is true then the function is allowed to explicitly start the player,
00052         // otherwise a startup attempt should not be made and different methods should be used.
00053         // This function is used for auto-detection and is called twice: the first time
00054         // with bStart set to false to determine the players that potentially could run.
00055         // If no player returns a reasonably high value by just guessing, then
00056         // a second loop may be attempted with the "bStart" parameter set to true.
00057         // A level of 0 is considered total failure: in this case detect() should
00058         // also set the last error to a descriptive string.
00059         virtual int detect(bool bStart) = 0;
00060 
00061         // play previous media, return false only on communication failure
00062         virtual bool prev() = 0;
00063         // play next media, return false only on communication failure
00064         virtual bool next() = 0;
00065         // start playback now, return false only on communication failure (i.e. return true when already playing)
00066         virtual bool play() = 0;
00067         // stop playback now, return false only on communication failure (i.e. return true when already stopped)
00068         virtual bool stop() = 0;
00069         // pause playback now (do NOT toggle pause, just pause), return false only on communication failure
00070         virtual bool pause() = 0;
00071 
00072         // current media related
00073 
00074         // currently played media: it should include AT least the title
00075         // but may also include other information.
00076         // this string MUST be non-empty when the player is playing something.
00077         // If it is empty then either the player is not playing or there are
00078         // communication errors.
00079         virtual QString nowPlaying() = 0;
00080         // currently played media resource locator
00081         // file://<filepath> for local files, dvb:// for dvb media, dvd:// for dvd's
00082         // http:// for audio streams etc...
00083         // empty if player is not playing (or in the tragic case that the player
00084         // can't determine the url).
00085         virtual QString mrl() = 0;
00086 
00087         // optional interface
00088 
00089         // this should play the specified mrl
00090         // the mrl may be (or may be not) added to the player's playlist
00091         // the function should return false if the player doesn't support
00092         // this function or there is a communication error
00093         virtual bool playMrl(const QString &mrl);
00094         // what is this ? :D
00095         virtual bool amipExec(const QString &cmd);
00096         virtual QString amipEval(const QString &cmd);
00097         // this is functions to hide,show and minimize the player interface
00098         virtual bool hide();
00099         virtual bool show();
00100         virtual bool minimize();
00101         // set the volume of mediaplayer (0-255)
00102         virtual bool setVol(kvs_int_t &iVol);
00103         // get the pvolume value(0-255)
00104         virtual int getVol();
00105         //mute the volume
00106         virtual bool mute();
00107         // should quit the player if it's running
00108         // return false only on communication failure
00109         virtual bool quit();
00110         // return the current player status
00111         enum PlayerStatus { Unknown, Stopped, Playing, Paused };
00112         virtual MpInterface::PlayerStatus status();
00113         // current position in the media (msecs)
00114         // 0 if the player isn't playing anything and -1 if unknown
00115         virtual int position();
00116         // total length of the media (msecs)
00117         // 0 if the player isn't playing anyting and -1 if unknown (e.g. a stream)
00118         virtual int length();
00119         // jump to position
00120         virtual bool jumpTo(kvs_int_t &iPos);
00121         // interface with a default implementation for certain types of media (read for mp3)
00122         // reimplement only if the player knows better
00123 
00124         // currently played media title (it's player choice if the title
00125         // is to be derived from the media file name or from the information
00126         // stored inside the file like the ID3 tag...)
00127         // If the player is not playing, the returned string should be empty
00128         virtual QString title();
00129         // currently played media artist's name
00130         // If the player is not playing, the returned string should be empty
00131         // If the player can't guess the artist it should return the string "unknown"
00132         virtual QString artist();
00133         // currently plaued media genre
00134         // If the player is not playing, the returned string should be empty
00135         // If the player can't guess the genre it should return the string "unknown"
00136         virtual QString genre();
00137         // currently played media comment.
00138         // Empty string if the player isn't playing anything or there is no comment
00139         virtual QString comment();
00140         // currently played media year
00141         // Empty string if the player isn't playing anything or the year is unknown
00142         virtual QString year();
00143         // currently played media album
00144         // Empty string if the player isn't playing anything
00145         // If the player can't guess the album/collection then this string should be "unknown"
00146         virtual QString album();
00147         // bit rate in bits/sec, 0 if unknown
00148         virtual int bitRate();
00149         // sample rate in samples/sec (Hz), 0 if unknown
00150         virtual int sampleRate();
00151         // number of channels
00152         virtual int channels();
00153         // frequency
00154         // the type of the media (MPEG Layer 3, MPEG Layer 4, OGG Vorbis, AVI Stream etc..)
00155         virtual QString mediaType();
00156         // get the position in the playlist
00157         virtual int getPlayListPos();
00158         // set the position in the playlist
00159         virtual bool setPlayListPos(kvs_int_t &iPos);
00160         // return the list's length
00161         virtual int getListLength();
00162         // return the Eq(number) value
00163         virtual int getEqData(kvs_int_t &i_val);
00164         // set the  Eq(iPos) to Eq(iVal) value
00165         virtual bool setEqData(kvs_int_t &iPos, kvs_int_t &iVal);
00166         // get the   Repeat bool value
00167         virtual bool getRepeat();
00168         // get the  shuffle bool value
00169         virtual bool getShuffle();
00170         // set the   Repeat bool value
00171         virtual bool setRepeat(bool &bVal);
00172         // set the  shuffle bool value
00173         virtual bool setShuffle(bool &bVal);
00174         void setLastError(const QString &szLastError){ m_szLastError = szLastError; };
00175 protected:
00176         void notImplemented();
00177         QString getLocalFile();
00178 };
00179 
00180 
00181 class MpInterfaceDescriptor
00182 {
00183 public:
00184         MpInterfaceDescriptor(){};
00185         virtual ~MpInterfaceDescriptor(){};
00186 public:
00187         virtual const QString & name() = 0;
00188         virtual const QString & description() = 0;
00189         virtual MpInterface * instance() = 0;
00190 };
00191 
00192 
00193 #define MP_DECLARE_DESCRIPTOR(_interfaceclass) \
00194         class _interfaceclass ## Descriptor : public MpInterfaceDescriptor \
00195         { \
00196         public: \
00197                 _interfaceclass ## Descriptor(); \
00198                 virtual ~_interfaceclass ## Descriptor(); \
00199         protected: \
00200                 _interfaceclass * m_pInstance; \
00201                 QString m_szName; \
00202                 QString m_szDescription; \
00203         public: \
00204                 virtual const QString & name(); \
00205                 virtual const QString & description(); \
00206                 virtual MpInterface * instance(); \
00207         };
00208 
00209 #define MP_IMPLEMENT_DESCRIPTOR(_interfaceclass,_name,_description) \
00210         _interfaceclass ## Descriptor::_interfaceclass ## Descriptor() \
00211         : MpInterfaceDescriptor() \
00212         { \
00213                 m_pInstance = 0; \
00214                 m_szName = _name; \
00215                 m_szDescription = _description; \
00216         } \
00217         _interfaceclass ## Descriptor::~_interfaceclass ## Descriptor() \
00218         { \
00219                 if(m_pInstance)delete m_pInstance; \
00220         } \
00221         const QString & _interfaceclass ## Descriptor::name() \
00222         { \
00223                 return m_szName; \
00224         } \
00225         const QString & _interfaceclass ## Descriptor::description() \
00226         { \
00227                 return m_szDescription; \
00228         } \
00229         MpInterface * _interfaceclass ## Descriptor::instance() \
00230         { \
00231                 if(!m_pInstance)m_pInstance = new _interfaceclass(); \
00232                 return m_pInstance; \
00233         }
00234 
00235 #define MP_CREATE_DESCRIPTOR(_interfaceclass) \
00236         new _interfaceclass ## Descriptor()
00237 
00238 #endif //!_MP_INTERFACE_H_
